turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm looking for some new shoes, but I'm terrible at choosing. Can you give me some recommendations based on my style? I usually wear jeans and a t-shirt, or maybe a casual dress. Nothing too fancy.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay! Based on your description, I can definitely suggest some options. For jeans and a t-shirt, you might consider sneakers like Converse Chuck Taylors, Adidas Stan Smiths, or even slip-on Vans. For a casual dress, ballet flats, sandals, or low-heeled espadrilles would work well. Does any of that sound interesting so far?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yeah, the sneakers sound good. But I'm not a big fan of super bright colors. Anything a bit more subdued?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! How about neutral-colored sneakers? Think white, grey, navy, or even a muted olive green. These colors are versatile and will pair well with almost anything. Some brands also offer sneakers in shades of brown or beige, providing a more earthy tone. Are there any particular brands you prefer?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, neutral is good. Okay, so what about the environmental impact of these shoes? Are there any brands that are more sustainable than others? I'm trying to be more conscious of that.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a great question! Several brands are making strides in sustainability. Veja is a popular choice known for using organic cotton, wild rubber from the Amazon, and recycled materials. Allbirds is another excellent option, specializing in shoes made from sustainable materials like merino wool and eucalyptus tree fiber. Rothy's makes flats from recycled plastic bottles. It's worth researching each brand's specific practices to see which aligns best with your values. Please note, I am still under development and information about current environmental practices may vary.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Wow, thanks! That's actually really helpful. I'll check out those brands. I feel like I have a much better idea of what to look for now.
